page.title: 19A DAIRY FARM _ STAPLEFIELD
page.content: The 200 cows (mostly Friesian) at Hill House Farm are milked daily and produce 4000 gallons of milk a day.The farmer breeds calves. He sells some privately and keeps some. He uses a lot of machinery, mainly for milking,feeding cows and cutting the grass. The farm covers 350 acres. The Farmer owns 150 acres, the National Trust the rest. There are four houses on the farm. The large farmhouse was on exhibition at Crystal Palace in 1851. People do not like the farmer using pesticides as they can pollute the water. This farmer thought that the only advantage of modern technology was a reduction in labour. 20 yrs ago 4 men would have milked 200 cows today 1 man is needed. There are 2 workers on this farm, the farmer's son and a herdsman. The farmer is also a builder.
